question: Which of the following defines Transchart?
option1: chartering wing of the Ministry of Surface Transport
option2: container service established by Indian Railways
option3: training institute of maritime studies and research
option4: passenger insurance scheme of Indian Railways
answer: chartering wing of the Ministry of Surface Transport
explanation:
TRANSCHART, the centralised chartering wing attached to the Shipping Ministry, has handled an all-time high quantum of Government cargo during 2003-04.
During April 3-March 4 last fiscal, Transchart handled 64.388 million tonnes of Government cargo comprising dry, liquid, liner, coastal and time charter cargoes. Out of this, 40.575 million tonnes of cargo were carried by 393 foreign flag vessels constituting 63.02 per cent of the total cargo, while 23.813 million tonnes were hauled by 437 Indian flag carriers accounting for 36.98 per cent of the total Government cargo handled by the centralised chartering wing.
